message: (not this site's fault, it's chrome's)
It wouldn't run in a browser, and would be more responsive
[sorry if this is the wrong place for this.. let me know if it is]
gamers eh... I'm targeting business users moreso :-P
Apparently the unofficial business thinking is charging for private/hidden groups
But I'd expect that to become more "private groups with more than X users"
Maybe a 'premium' version will enable 'enterprise solutions' and the free version will remain its' rad self. Anyway, back to this being about a desktop app? :-)
@spencer There is a target, but we do not know it.. yet. ;)

What I like about Convore is that there isn't a target, as far as I can tell. It's for everyone to use how they please. Adding business features will complicate it for people using it as an IRC replacement, etc.

If you could pull out a on-top-of-everything desktop app, you would definitely gain a fair bit of popularity for yourself, your app and this website as I believe that quite a lot of gamers would use it. Well.. not only gamers, of curse
Responsiveness would be really good right about now!
But that's a different topic altogether :-p
The challenge with business users isn't adding complexity, it's reducing complexity while maintaining utility

@mal your question about cursor in "ask us developers anything" - I can't tell if you're using the API or it's a problem with the convore site itself. You say "deleting my cursor doesn't help" which implies you are messing with the API...
if you're constructing a request to live and you pass a garbage value to cursor= then it will immediately respond back saying no messages
sorry for seemingly hijacking the issue into an API topic, but it's something all API developers should be aware of

Ahh right, well it turned out to be a convore problem (https://convore.com/feedback/whole-page-refresh/) I was playing with my cursor with firebug, changing it from "null" to "" seemed to temporarily fix the issue (now resolved by the convore dev team)
are things i would want in a desktop app
also if the icon has a flame on it and represents some sort of fuel source, that would be great
@protocool i dunno
propane is pretty much the only reason we use campfire
lol
cough
file sharing, notifications, keyboard commands, separate dock icon
#justsayin
I hear that a lot
I like making dock icons.
for people in multiple campfire groups it might be pretty awesome to have convore support
@defunkt I asked kyle if he thought it was something to put in Propane or a separate app... any prefs?
then i'd have an excuse to buy propane finally
+1 for convore support in propane
I don't use propane so I don't mind if it's a separate app
@protocool I guess it depends on if the convore audience is the same as the campfire audience and/or if the two can be combined
